results:
Based on the search results, I can provide you with comprehensive information about Pan Tadeusz and its connection to UNESCO Memory of the World and educational materials:

## Pan Tadeusz and UNESCO Memory of the World

In 2014 Pan Tadeusz was incorporated into Poland's list in the UNESCO Memory of the World Programme.(no content)The manuscript of "Pan Tadeusz" was incorporated into Poland's List in the UNESCO Memory of the World Programme in 2014 as a valuable monument of Polish culture, a historical memento and a carrier of national values.

## Educational Significance

Pan Tadeusz, Poland's national epic, is compulsory reading in Polish schools and has been translated into 33 languages.(no content)Pan Tadeusz is required reading in Polish schools, and its original manuscript is considered to be the most important holding of the Ossolineum.

## The Pan Tadeusz Museum and Educational Materials

The Pan Tadeusz Museum in Wrocław serves as a major educational resource:

### Museum Features
Pan Tadeusz Museum is the latest and the most modern part of the Ossolineum, exhibiting collections of the Institute on the rich historical and literary background. It was opened to public in May 2016 in one of the most beautiful tenement houses in Wrocław – Under the Golden Sun (Rynek 6).

### Educational Mission
Education is one of the pillars of the Museum's mission. Special educational scripts have been prepared for the teachers.(no content)The Museum's offer caters for schools as well as families, adults and extracurricular classes (visual arts, literary, even cooking).

The museum features "several hundred authentic other manuscripts, old prints, etchings, paintings, sculptures and objects of daily use and complemented by over a hundred applications and multimedia presentations" that create educational resources about Polish culture and history.

### Educational Programs
The museum has developed interactive educational approaches, including "costume from the period (as suggested in one of the scripts) or engage in a discussion with an avatar (created by animation artists wearing a special costume in a separate room)."

The museum has been highly successful, with over 340,000 visitors up till May 2024, and in 2019 it received a special commendation of the European Museum of the Year Award.
